page.title: 12Burton Latimer - Industry
page.content: There are 33 factories in the town. Alumasc and Weetabix are the most well known.Alumasc was originally a war time government factory built circa 1941. They made casings for bombs.When the factory was no longer needed in 1944, Erc Lewis made a deal with a company called Arthur Strauss& Co., to set up a new aluminium based company. The name "Alumasc" comes from "ALUminium" & the initial letters of Arthur Strauss & Co. The company began by making pots and pans called "Holloware".In 1951 Alumasc started to make aluminium beer barrels for which it is probably best known.
